title: Astros' Gerrit Cole makes postseason history with 15 strikeouts in Game 2 of ALDS
text:
CLOSE

How do you top Justin Verlander's vintage postseason start in Game 1 of the American League Division Series?

Start Gerrit Cole in Game 2.

The Astros right-hander delivered a historic 15-strikeout outing in Houston's 3-1 victory in Game 2 of the ALDS against the Tampa Bay Rays.

Cole will be mentioned in the same breath as Bob Gibson and Sandy Koufax in postseason lore after his 15 K's Saturday night in front of a home crowd at Minute Maid Park.

In an October performance to remember, Cole dominated the Rays and became the seventh pitcher to strike out at least 15 in a postseason game and the first since Roger Clemens did it for the Yankees in Game 4 of the 2000 AL Championship Series.

Gerrit Cole acknowledges the fans as he leaves the game after 15 strikeouts. (Photo: Thomas Shea, USA TODAY Sports)

"That guy is unbelievable," said third baseman Alex Bregman. "He's just like Justin (Verlander), they both prepare so well."

Gibson holds the postseason record with 17 in Game 1 of the 1968 World Series. Cole tied Koufax and three others for the third-most strikeouts.

More: Didi Gregorius hits grand slam, Yankees rout Twins to take 2-0 ALDS lead

More: Minnesota Twins postseason misery continues: Record losing streak reaches 15 games

The 15 K's also set an franchise postseason record and ALDS record.

And to join even more elite company, Cole has two career postseason games where he has struck out at least 12. Only three other pitchers in baseball history have done that, and no one has done it more. Tom Seaver, Jim Palmer, and Gibson each did it twice.

Cole exited the game after 7⅔ innings leading 3-0. He threw a season-high 118 pitches, 83 for strikes, walked one with no earned runs.

And, what may be the most impressive statistic of the night -- Cole had 33 swings-and-misses, the most since 2008 when the stat was tracked.

The only pitchers in postseason history with more strikeouts than Gerrit Cole are Bob Gibson and Kevin Brown — Bob Nightengale (@BNightengale) October 6, 2019

.@GerritCole45's 15 Ks in a single game are a #postseason record for the @astros.



Only Bob Gibson (17) and Kevin Brown (16) have ever had more in a postseason game. pic.twitter.com/dhSttJpnko — MLB Stats (@MLBStats) October 6, 2019

description: Astros pitcher Gerrit Cole set a franchise postseason and ALDS record with 15 strikeouts while going 7 2/3 innings in Game 2 against the Rays.
